category.text: $course$/top/importados/Exam With Question and their variants/Question 01 - Descriptive Statistics - CLOZE

name.text: Variante 01 de Question 01 - Descriptive Statistics - CLOZE

questiontext.text:
Consider the following sample:

## 10 9.6 7.3 8.8 10.6 10.8 7.6 9.3 6.7 9.5

(a)

The sample mean is {:NUMERICAL:=9.02:0.1} (round to 1 decimal place).

(b)

The maximum value of the sample is {:NUMERICAL:=10.8}.

category.text: $course$/top/importados/Exam With Question and their variants/Question 01 - Descriptive Statistics - CLOZE

name.text: Variante 02 de Question 01 - Descriptive Statistics - CLOZE

questiontext.text:
Consider the following sample:

## 22.2 21.5 19.5 22 21.5 20.2 18.1 19.6 21.9 21

(a)

The sample mean is {:NUMERICAL:=20.75:0.1} (round to 1 decimal place).

(b)

The minimum value of the sample is {:NUMERICAL:=22.2}.

category.text: $course$/top/importados/Exam With Question and their variants/Question 01 - Descriptive Statistics - CLOZE

name.text: Variante 03 de Question 01 - Descriptive Statistics - CLOZE

questiontext.text:
Consider the following sample:

## 28.8 25.6 28.7 25.8 27.5 29.3 28.6 28.3 29.8 29.5

(a)

The sample mean is {:NUMERICAL:=28.19:0.1} (round to 1 decimal place).

(b)

The value of \(x_2\) is {:NUMERICAL:=25.6}.
